section.title: Apache httpd configuration
section.para: You need to load the modules that are needed for mod_cluster for example:LoadModule proxy_module modules/mod_proxy.so LoadModule proxy_ajp_module modules/mod_proxy_ajp.so LoadModule slotmem_module modules/mod_slotmem.so LoadModule manager_module modules/mod_manager.so LoadModule proxy_cluster_module modules/mod_proxy_cluster.so LoadModule advertise_module modules/mod_advertise.so

mod_proxy and mod_proxy_ajp are standard httpd modules. mod_slotmem is a shared slotmem memory provider. mod_manager is the module that reads information from JBoss AS/JBossWeb/Tomcat and updates the shared memory information. mod_proxy_cluster is the module that contains the balancer for mod_proxy. mod_advertise is an additional module that allows httpd to advertise via multicast packets the IP and port where the mod_cluster is listening. This multi-module architecture allows the modules to easily be changed depending on what the customer wants to do. For example when using http instead of AJP, only
needs to be changed to:

section.title: mod_proxy configuration
section.para: mod_proxy directives like ProxyIOBufferSize could be used to configure mod_cluster. There is no need to use ProxyPass directives because mod_cluster automatically configures which URLs have to be forwarded to JBossWEB.

section.title: mod_slotmem configuration
section.para: The actual version doesn't require any configuration directives.

section.title: CreateBalancers
section.para: CreateBalancers: Define how the balancer are created in the httpd VirtualHosts, this is to allow directives like:
0: Create in all VirtualHosts defined in httpd.
1: Don't create balancers (requires at least one ProxyPass/ProxyPassMatch to define the balancer names).
2: Create only the main server.
Default: 2

Note: When using 1 don't forget to configure the balancer in the ProxyPass directive, because the default is empty stickysession and nofailover=Off and the values received via the MCMP CONFIG message are ignored.

section.title: UseAlias
section.para: UseAlias: Check that the Alias corresponds to the ServerName (See Host Name Aliases)
0: Don't (ignore Aliases)
1: Check it
Default: 0 Ignore the Alias information from the nodes.

section.title: LBstatusRecalTime
section.para: LBstatusRecalTime: Time interval in seconds for loadbalancing logic to recalculate the status of a node
Default: 5 seconds
The actual formula to recalculate the status of a node is:
lbfactor is received for the node via STATUS messages.lbstatus is recalculated every LBstatusRecalTime seconds using the formula:

elected is the number of time the worker was elected.oldelected is elected last time the lbstatus was recalculated.The node with the lowest status is selected. Nodes with lbfactor ≤ 0 are skipped by the both calculation logic.

section.title: WaitForRemove
section.para: WaitForRemove: Time in seconds before a removed node is forgotten by httpd
Default: 10 seconds

section.title: ProxyPassMatch/ProxyPass
section.para: ProxyPassMatch/ProxyPass: ProxyPassMatch and ProxyPass are mod_proxy directives that when using ! (instead the back-end url) prevent to reverse-proxy in the path. This could be used allow httpd to serve static information like images.
The above for example will allow httpd to server directly the .gif files.

section.title: mod_manager
section.para: The Context of a mod_manger directive is VirtualHost except mentioned otherwise. server config means that it must be outside a VirtualHost configuration. If not an error message will be displayed and httpd won't start.

section.title: EnableMCPMReceive
section.para: EnableMCPMReceive - Allow the VirtualHost to receive MCPM. Allow the VirtualHost to receive the MCPM from the nodes. You need one EnableMCPMReceive in your httpd configuration to allow mod_cluster to work, put it in the VirtualHost where you configure advertise.

section.title: MemManagerFile
section.para: MemManagerFile: That is the base name for the names mod_manager will use to store configuration, generate keys for shared memory or lock files. That must be an absolute path name; the directories will created if needed. It is highly recommended that those files are placed on a local drive and not an NFS share. (Context: server config)
Default: $server_root/logs/

section.title: Maxcontext
section.para: Maxcontext: That is the number max of contexts supported by mod_cluster. (Context: server config)
Default: 100

section.title: Maxnode
section.para: Maxnode: That is the number max nodes supported by mod_cluster. (Context: server config)
Default: 20

section.title: Maxhost
section.para: Maxhost: That is the number max host (Aliases) supported by mod_cluster. That is also the max number of balancers. (Context: server config)
Default: 10

section.title: Maxsessionid
section.para: Maxsessionid: That is the number of active sessionid we store to give number of active sessions in the mod_cluster-manager handler. A session is unactive when mod_cluster doesn't receive any information from the session in 5 minutes. (Context: server config)
Default: 0 (the logic is not activated).

section.title: MaxMCMPMaxMessSize
section.para: MaxMCMPMaxMessSize: Maximum size of MCMP messages. from other Max directives.
Default: calculated from other Max directives. Min: 1024

section.title: ManagerBalancerName
section.para: ManagerBalancerName: That is the name of balancer to use when the JBoss AS/JBossWeb/Tomcat doesn't provide a balancer name.
Default: mycluster

section.title: PersistSlots
section.para: PersistSlots: Tell mod_slotmem to persist the nodes, Alias and Context in files. (Context: server config)
Default: Off

section.title: CheckNonce
section.para: CheckNonce: Switch check of nonce when using mod_cluster-manager handler on | off Since 1.1.0.CR1
Default: on Nonce checked

section.title: AllowDisplay
section.para: AllowDisplay: Switch additional display on mod_cluster-manager main page on | off Since 1.1.0.GA
Default: off Only version displayed

section.title: AllowCmd
section.para: AllowCmd: Allow commands using mod_cluster-manager URL on | off Since 1.1.0.GA
Default: on Commmands allowed

section.title: ReduceDisplay
section.para: ReduceDisplay - Reduce the information the main mod_cluster-manager page to allow more nodes in the page. on | off
Default: off Full information displayed

section.title: SetHandler mod_cluster-manager
section.para: SetHandler mod_cluster-manager: That is the handler to display the node mod_cluster sees from the cluster. It displays the information about the nodes like INFO and additionaly counts the number of active sessions.

para.programlisting: <Location /mod_cluster-manager> SetHandler mod_cluster-manager Order deny,allow Deny from all Allow from 127.0.0.1 </Location>

section.para: When accessing the location you define in httpd.conf you get something like:
Note that:
Transferred: Corresponds to the POST data send to the back-end server.
Connected: Corresponds to the number of requests been processed when the mod_cluster status page was requested.
sessions: Corresponds to the number of sessions mod_cluster report as active (on which there was a request during the past 5 minutes). That field is not present when Maxsessionid is zero.

section.title: mod_advertise
section.para: mod_advertise uses multicast packets to advertise the VirtualHost where it is configured that must be the same VirtualHost where mod_manager is defined. Of course at least one mod_advertise must be in the VirtualHost to allow mod_cluster to find the right IP and port to give to the ClusterListener.

section.title: ServerAdvertise
section.para: ServerAdvertise On: Use the advertise mechanism to tell the JBoss AS/JBossWeb/Tomcat to whom it should send the cluster information.

ServerAdvertise On http://hostname:port: Tell the hostname and port to use. Only needed if the VirtualHost is not defined correctly, if the VirtualHost is a Name-based Virtual Host or when VirtualHost is not used.
ServerAdvertise Off: Don't use the advertise mechanism.
Default: Off. (Any Advertise directive in a VirtualHost sets it to On in the VirtualHost)

section.title: AdvertiseGroup
section.para: AdvertiseGroup IP:port: That is the multicast address to use (something like 232.0.0.2:8888 for example). IP should correspond to AdvertiseGroupAddress and port to AdvertisePort in the JBoss AS/JBossWeb/Tomcat configuration. Note that if JBoss AS is used and the -u startup switch is included in the AS startup command, the default AdvertiseGroupAddress is the value passed via the -u. If port is missing the default port will be used: 23364.

section.title: AdvertiseFrequency
section.para: AdvertiseFrequency seconds[.miliseconds]: Time between the multicast messages advertising the IP and port.
Default: 10 Ten seconds.

section.title: AdvertiseSecurityKey
section.para: AdvertiseSecurityKey value: key string to identify the mod_cluster in JBossWEB.
Default: No default value. Information not sent.

section.title: AdvertiseManagerUrl
section.para: AdvertiseManagerUrl value: Not used in this version (It is sent in the X-Manager-Url: value header). That is the URL that JBoss AS/JBossWeb/Tomcat should use to send information to mod_cluster
Default: No default value. Information not sent.

section.title: AdvertiseBindAddress
section.para: AdvertiseBindAddress IP:port: That is the address and port httpd is bind to send the multicast messages. This allow to specify an address on multi IP address boxes.

para.programlisting:
LoadModule proxy_module modules/mod_proxy.so LoadModule proxy_ajp_module modules/mod_proxy_ajp.so LoadModule slotmem_module modules/mod_slotmem.so LoadModule manager_module modules/mod_manager.so LoadModule proxy_cluster_module modules/mod_proxy_cluster.so LoadModule advertise_module modules/mod_advertise.so
Listen 10.33.144.3:6666 <VirtualHost 10.33.144.3:6666>
<Location /> Order deny,allow Deny from all Allow from 10.33.144. </Location>
KeepAliveTimeout 60 MaxKeepAliveRequests 0
ManagerBalancerName mycluster ServerAdvertise On EnableMCPMReceive
</VirtualHost>
